data.title: Atomic C# branch sync (WIP)
data.body: This PR is to get the current work on C# (and other improvements) on master.  The C# support is not currently ready for use and is effectively disabled on the master build. However, the changes in this branch need to get factored into the master branch

data.title: Can't rename prefabs in Editor
data.body:
It's not possible to rename prefabs in the editor, I'd suggest one (or all) of the following approaches:
1) When selecting a prefab, have the inspector show all details for- and components on it, as with an object in the scene editor. Allow it to be renamed in the inspector panel as with objects in the scene.
2) Add a right click context option to rename the prefab
3) When clicking on an already selected prefab, change it's name label into a textbox and allow it to be renamed that way

data.title: Still uses Urho3D's software culling
Using arrow keys in Hierarchy panel should select node in scene view
data.body:
It would also be helpful when selecting an object in the scene view, if its node also became active in the hierarchy panel.

Originally requested here: #159

data.title: Change default of Z-axis to 0 when importing 2D objects
Provide a unit of measurement option
data.body:
Allow users to choose which type they use in their project and be able to switch between them: pixels, meters, etc.

This becomes especially helpful when laying out 2D Sprites.

Originally requested here: #159

data.title: Add an optional lock to nodes in the hierarchy
data.body:
This is to prevent them from changing, moving, or getting deleted. This would also need to be visible in the inspector panel, i.e. the settings could be grayed out or the blue button indicating that a node is open/closed could become red.

Originally requested here: #159

data.title: Add right-click import on resources folders
data.body:
To quickly import sounds, textures, scenes, etc.

Originally requested here: #159

data.title: Tabbing between inspector fields should highlight the entry
data.body: Currently when tabbing through inspector fields the mouse cursor gets placed in the left-most position. If the entire field is highlighted it would make it a lot faster to modify.

data.title: Fix behavior of closing files in the editor
data.body:
This is the current behavior:
If multiple files are open and you click on the X to close a file or use File/Close File, the file furthest to the right becomes active, unless it is a scene file then all files become inactive.

How it should work when multiple files are open:
- If you close a file, the current file should remain active
- If you close the file you're working in, the next file should become active
- If you close a file with unsaved changes, you should be prompted to save changes before closing

Issue originally reported here: #159

data.title: Add default arguments to Node.AddComponent
data.body:
0 for id, replicated for mode

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Source/Atomic/Scene/Node.h#L548

data.title: Fix IPC issue on Windows which was causing reads to hang and a proble…
data.body: …m at exit

data.title: node.getJSComponent needs an option to not recurse
data.body: Currently, node.getJSComponent will traverse child nodes for the provided component if the parent that it's called on does not contain that component.  The function needs to provide an optional recurse parameter to disallow this.  Ideally, the signature should match node.getComponent(name, recurse?)

data.title: Axis gizmo remains visible when deleting a node in editor
data.body:
In the editor, in a 3D scene:
+Create a new node
+Select the node so that the axis gizmo is at it's location
+Delete the node
+Note that the gizmo remains at the deleted node's position until something else is selected

data.title: Play button should change to a stop button when playing and not allow additional processes.
data.body: When playing a project, the play button in the editor should change to a stop button or otherwise clearly indicate that it is active. It should also not allow additional processes to be started by pressing play. Ideally, pressing the button when in a play state should end the current play process.

data.title: Player processes are not shut down when playing from editor
data.body:
On Windows 7, a freshly built editor from commit 48ed8c5.
+Open Task Manager, observe there is a single AtomicEditor.exe instance running. 
+Open a project with a simple main.js that does not load any resources or scenes. 
+Press play and wait for the player window to open.
+Closing the player and console windows
+Observe in Task Manager that there is an additional AtomicEditor.exe process consuming 5-7MB,

Repeating the test, new processes will be spawned and leaked for each run.

data.title: Update TypeScript compiler to 1.6.2
UIMenuBar separator "-" break uses AESeparator skin which is only available in the editor
data.body:
Need to specify a common separator skin for usage in player

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Source/Atomic/UI/UIMenubar.cpp#L228

data.title: Player doesn't pickup coins in physics platformer (windows)
data.body: The coins bounce off the player in the editor and on Windows deployment. However, they behave properly when deployed to Android from Windows.

data.title: Trim down assimp importer types to improve compilation time
data.body: There are a number of assimp file importers which take awhile to compile, however will never be used

data.title: UI Possible Crash
Adding WebSocket support for native
data.body:
There's no Emscripten support, yet, but it's planned. Also, a WebRequest, which will replace functionality of Network/HttpRequest will be added with native and Emsciripten support.

(The Network subsystem is not built for Emscripten because it uses kNet, but this new Web subsystem will not have any dependencies that would cause problems in the Emscripten environment.)

data.title: Make it possible to edit resource XML parameters in the editor
data.body:
Resources such as textures and sounds can have XML parameters which are stored alongside the resource file.  For example:

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Source/Atomic/Audio/Sound.cpp#L341

Settings such as "looped" for sounds should be stored in the .asset file (which is generated by the AudioImporter) with an XML file of necessary settings written to the Cache/ folder in the corresponding subfolder, for example:

```
MyProject
    Cache
        Sounds/MySound.xml
    Resources
        Sounds/MySound.ogg
```

An inspector should be created for sound resources with a "Looped" checkbox, here's a simple "PrefabInspector" example, note the apply button functionality:

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Script/AtomicEditor/ui/frames/inspector/PrefabInspector.ts

data.title: Zone::SetAmbientColor ignores alpha component, which is a problem for 2D lighting
Fix Quit button in Space Game example
data.body: The Quit button does not work the same across all platforms. It works properly on desktop and Android, but is unresponsive on iOS.

data.title: Use the icon from the Build Settings in deployed mobile applications
data.body:
- on iOS, the default app icon is being used
- on Android, an old Atomic logo is being used

data.title: Build Output window is blank when deploying to Windows
data.body: There needs to be messaging to let users know that the build was successful. See Mac deployment output.

data.title: Build settings for windows deployment are not saving
data.body: This applies to deploying to windows from Mac and Windows.

data.title: Shortcuts like Save File, Close File, Run, Build, now works
